nodes.content: Progression on entrectinib, crizotinib, or repotrectinib

Consider definitive local therapy (eg, SABR or surgery) for limited lesions
Continue crizotinib, entrectinib, or repotrectinib
or
Repotrectinib (if not previously given) or Lorlatinib

Consider definitive local therapy (eg, SRS)
Repotrectinib or Lorlatinib (preferred) or Entrectinib (useful in certain circumstances, if previously treated with crizotinib) or clinical trial
NCCN Guidelines for CNS Cancers

Consider definitive local therapy (eg, SABR or surgery)
Continue entrectinib, crizotinib, or repotrectinib
or
Therapy for multiple lesions, below

Repotrectinib (if not previously given) or Lorlatinib
or
Systemic therapy options
Adenocarcinoma (NSCL-K 1 of 5) or Squamous Cell Carcinoma (NSCL-K 2 of 5)
Progression, Systemic Therapy Adenocarcinoma (NSCL-K 1 of 5) or Squamous Cell Carcinoma (NSCL-K 2 of 5)

tree_references.description: Systemic therapy options for Squamous Cell Carcinoma
Principles of Image-Guided Thermal Ablation Therapy
Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis
Molecular or Biomarker-Directed Therapy for Advanced or Metastatic Disease

footnotes.label: o
footnotes.content: IGTA therapy (eg, cryotherapy, microwave, radiofrequency) may be an option for select patients. See Principles of Image-Guided Thermal Ablation Therapy (NSCL-D).

footnotes.label: nn
footnotes.content: Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis (NSCL-H).

footnotes.label: rr
footnotes.content: Molecular or Biomarker-Directed Therapy for Advanced or Metastatic Disease (NSCL-J).

footnotes.label: yy
footnotes.content: Beware of flare phenomenon in subset of patients who discontinue TKI. If disease flare occurs, restart TKI.

footnotes.label: zz
footnotes.content: Clinical trials have included up to 3 to 5 progressing sites.

footnotes.label: bbb
footnotes.content: Definitive local therapy of CNS disease can include asymptomatic lesions at risk for symptomatic progression based on factors including site, location, and edema.

footnotes.label: fff
footnotes.content: Plasma or tissue-based testing via broad molecular profiling should be considered at progression for genomic resistance mechanisms. If plasma-based testing is negative, tissue-based testing with rebiopsy material is strongly recommended. Practitioners may want to consider scheduling the biopsy concurrently with plasma testing referral.

footnotes.label: ppp
footnotes.content: Repotrectinib is an option for resistant mutations, such as ROS1 G2032R.
